title: no-mod-root failing after block 4207077
body:

I verified the state file by using
````
./build/bin/state -action verifySnapshot -chaindata /mnt/disks/nvme/state
````
and got the output:
````
Block number: 0
Block root hash: d7f8974fb5ac78d9ac099b9ad5018bedc2ce0a72dad1827a1709da30580f0544
mismatching hash: <d7f8974fb5ac78d9ac099b9ad5018bedc2ce0a72dad1827a1709da30580f0544>  049bac1cf6819b3e074399f6d59602d9bab0c32eaaf06799ab63c97600a7a117 for prefix ,
 resolveHex , resolvePos 0
Trie computation took 16.127296564s
Storage trie computation took 41.287050808s
````
That gave me the root hash `049bac1cf6819b3e074399f6d59602d9bab0c32eaaf06799ab63c97600a7a117` which I used to figure out the block number:
````
./build/bin/hack -action testBlockHashes -chaindata /mnt/disks/nvme/geth/chaindata -blo
ck 4207000 -hash 049bac1cf6819b3e074399f6d59602d9bab0c32eaaf06799ab63c97600a7a117
````
and got the output:
````
===============
Canonical hash for 4207077: 2d2307dc940b3366fe5a9aeccb0c4c09d21ef2ef385e5b4ed8986fcce10c2766
Header.Root: 049bac1cf6819b3e074399f6d59602d9bab0c32eaaf06799ab63c97600a7a117
Header.TxHash: 8493c4fde8c6d6ab37c5c17a30cb1398619688145ad4519b5564e470bc9ada00
Header.UncleHash: 1dcc4de8dec75d7aab85b567b6ccd41ad312451b948a7413f0a142fd40d49347
````

This is how I determined the state file corresponds to the state just after `4207077` and I need to re-run the next time with `-block 4207078` to debug
Figured out how to fix it, and it goes ahead. PR incoming soon
